meanings.definition: The act of entrusting someone with something.
meanings.sent1: Her entrustments of important tasks to her assistant showed her trust in him.
meanings.sent2: The safekeeping of the family heirlooms was one of the entrustments given to the eldest son.
meanings.sent3: The entrustments of babysitting the mischievous twins often led to chaotic but fun evenings.
meanings.sent4: His entrustments of leadership responsibilities to his team members transformed them into capable leaders themselves.
meanings.sent5: The entrustments of the secret mission to the skilled agent ensured its success.

meanings.definition: Things that are entrusted to someone.
meanings.sent1: The valuable jewelry was among the entrustments left in the care of the trustworthy neighbor.
meanings.sent2: He carefully packed all the entrustments in a secure box before handing them over to the courier.
meanings.sent3: The entrustments of the school supplies to the forgetful student often resulted in missing items.
meanings.sent4: The entrustments of the company's financial records to the accountant were crucial for the audit.
meanings.sent5: The entrustments of the top-secret files to the spy were vital for the mission's success.
